page.title: 20INTERVIEW WITH HEADTEACHER
page.content: Mrs Baber likes being with children and people of all ages.She was a scale 2 teacher, spending some of her time acting as Deputy Head. Enjoying this, she applied to Dunton Bassett School, as she liked both the School and village. Currently, Mrs Baber is Acting Head Teacher. She likes village schools as she knows all the families very well. The School was built in 1849 and extended in 1873 and 1909. The Quiet Area was built in 1983 and the school garden in 1984. The infants won Â£20 in a competition, entering a picture of the village; they used the money to build a pond. The School is currently run by the Head, Deputy, 2 staff, 4 dinner ladies, p/t ancillary and secretary, County Hall and Governors. The School will not change, but teaching methods may in the future {By Karen Drinkwater Age 8. 11.6.85.
